intro: Erysimum sulphureum, commonly known as the sulphur yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow, elongated flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has linear, often hairy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its vibrant color and relatively low maintenance make it a valued ornamental plant in horticulture.
